title: 112_hr3448
content: The Act titled "Returning Investment to America Act of 2011" extends the dividends received deduction for dividends received from controlled foreign corporations by corporations increasing payroll. The Act extends the election under section 965 of the Internal Revenue Code for taxable years before December 31, 2012, allowing revocation only with the Secretary's consent. If a member of a controlled group makes the election, it applies to all members of the group. The Act extends the election under section 965 of the Internal Revenue Code for taxable years before December 31, 2012, allowing revocation only with the Secretary's consent for a member of a controlled group. The deduction is limited by payroll increase and property placed in service. The Act extends the election under section 965 of the Internal Revenue Code for taxable years before December 31, 2012, allowing revocation only with the Secretary's consent for a member of a controlled group. The deduction is limited by payroll increase and property placed in service during the taxable year. The term 'inflation adjusted wages' refers to wages multiplied by the cost-of-living adjustment for the relevant calendar year. The taxpayer may elect to increase the reinvestment amount for 2012 by the employer's payroll increase for the previous year and the basis of qualified property placed in service after the mid-point of the previous year. Qualified property refers to tangible personal property eligible for depreciation or amortization. The IRS regulations allow for adjustments in the amount of wages or compensation deemed paid by an employer in cases of acquisitions of a trade or business. The IRS regulations allow adjustments in wages or compensation for acquisitions of a trade or business, attributing the acquired portion to the employer. Dispositions of a major portion of a trade or business require furnishing necessary information for application of the regulations. The IRS regulations allow adjustments in wages or compensation for acquisitions of a trade or business. Dispositions of a major portion of a trade or business require furnishing necessary information for application of the regulations. Subsection (c) of section 965 of the Code is amended to redesignate paragraphs and make conforming amendments. The amendments made by this section under subsection (b) shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2011.
